title: Still No S

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body: So, perfect game, decent score, still no S, why is a perfect game if your team wins not considered s worthy automatically? it doesnt mean much as ive earnt the chest and dont have ml5 but I still want the satisfation of earning an S.

replies.body: If you look at the statistics you were outclassed in almost every way.

You think that's bad... I got a S- for going 40/2/5 as Vayne with a Pentakill in 25mins...
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/141124496/200038995?tab=overview

The standards for supports are as follows

-You need to get at least half the amount of assist of kills that your team has
- Your Kills has to be double the amount of your death 
- You need to have decent ward coverage at least 1 ward every 2 min
- Your CS is calculated by the the timer, Every 10 min at least 10-15 CS is needed

The thing above is based on the standards of supports across all Elo
That's ridiculous, especially if your team is getting solo kills early and such, but eh, never said it was fair, just annoying, thanks for the info.
Sona will be a hard one to get an S on, she was broken earlier this patch (and received a hotfix nerf for it) so she will be really hard to get S's on.
I'm actually going to disagree. You can legit just sit back and heal like a soraka with a movement speed boost build. Throw out some poke here and there purely just to peel and that's an easy s
